questions.text: How does the circulatory regulation try to compensate the effects of blood loss (hemorrhage)?

options.text: the total peripheral resistance will increase
plasma ANH levels are elevated
sympathetic vasoconstrictor tone increases in the capacitance vessels (veins)
central venous pressure will be increased
cardiac output increases

questions.text: 500 ml blood is infused into the cubital vein. As a result

options.text: the increment of arterial blood volume is very small
venous pressure increases
pressure in the right atrium increases
hydrostatic pressure in the veins increases
cardiac output increases
influence ADH secretion
mediate the Bezold-Jarish reflex
stimulate the pressor center
mediate the Herin-Breuer reflex
elicit a drop in blood pressure
is elicited by stretching the pulmonary arteries
is a depressor reflex
originates from the right atrial baroreceptors
increases heart rate in response to enhanced venous return
can be elicited by administering veratridine
can be calculated from oxygen consumption and arterial and venous oxygen content
is the product of heart rate and stroke volume
is reduced by stimulation of the vagus nerve
is increased by stimulation of sympathetic nerves to the heart
may vary in adults from 4 liters/min to 25 liters/min

questions.text: Which of the following statements are correct?

is lower than the normal central venous pressure

is the same as the normal mean capillary pressure
increases with hypervolemia
arterial pressure is decreased
venous pressure increases
arterial and venous pressure falls to zero
interstitial fluid is reabsorbed into the vessels
the blood volume in the low-pressure areas of the circulatory system decrease

questions.text: Factors increasing the central venous pressure include

options.text: increased peripheral resistance
